name: TV Mini-Series Quiz | TV Mini-Series and Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: "The Thorn Birds" included what legendary movie actress in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Barbara Stanwyck.

	An aging Stanwyck - in one of her last performances. With Rachel Ward and Richard Chamberlain (who is probably the "king" of the mini-series).

questions.text: "Shogun" was also a popular mini-series? Who wrote the novel?
questions.explanation:
James Clavell.

	Action in the Orient.

questions.text: Robert Mitchum starred in "The Winds of War". In what branch of the service did his character ("Pug" Henry) serve?
questions.explanation:
Navy.

	Great novel by Herman Wouk (followed by the sequel, "War and Remembrance".)Wouk also did the naval novel, "The Caine Mutiny".

Irwin Shaw.

	An early mini-series. Not bad.

questions.text: Peter O'Toole played what role in "Masada"?
questions.explanation:
Roman soldier.

	O'Toole deserved recognition for his lifetime work. Excellent actor.

questions.text: "Holocaust" included which of these actresses in a starring role?
questions.explanation:
Meryl Streep.

	An early mini-series and an early Streep. Well done.

questions.text: "Centennial" is set in a fictional town. In what state?
questions.explanation:
Colorado.

	From the novel by James Michener.

questions.text: Who starred in Taylor Caldwell's "Captains and the Kings"?
questions.explanation:
Richard Jordan.

	Birney was in Caldwell's "Testimony of Two Men". Nolte was in "Rich Man, Poor Man", as was Strauss (who was also in "Masada").

questions.text: The most famous of all TV mini-series is "Roots". Who played Kunta Kinte?
questions.explanation:
Levar Burton.

	Haley wrote it. A TV landmark.
